bug.author: gqqnbig
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/docs/blob/master/site/en/tutorials/estimator/boosted_trees_model_understanding.ipynb>https://github.com/tensorflow/docs/blob/master/site/en/tutorials/estimator/boosted_trees_model_understanding.ipynb</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Description of issue (what needs changing):</denchmark-h>
The tutorials says
For performance reasons, when your data fits in memory, we recommend use the boosted_trees_classifier_train_in_memory function.
However, function doesn't exist. It's actually removed in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/ffc25308ce2be84240ec90502b38800bc5a4dd60>ffc2530</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-h:h3>Submit a pull request?</denchmark-h>
I'm not sure whether it's fine to simply remove the sentense. You guys may want to add something else.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/gqqnbig>@gqqnbig</denchmark-link> I think that there is a new arg at <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/estimator/BoostedTreesClassifier>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/estimator/BoostedTreesClassifier</denchmark-link> . Can you send a small PR to refactor that sentence?
Closing this issue since the associated PR has merged and fixes it. Thanks!
